events.name: The Hacker Games: Cal-Tech Qualification Round and Mixer
events.about:
The Hacker Games is an annual competition between hackers from the best universities in the country. Five winners from each university will be flown to San Francisco to compete in the The Hacker Games hackathon. 

The Hacker Games CalTech Qualification Round and Mixer is on October 13, 2012.  Youll hear from some of the best startups in the area, meet amazing people, and have a chance to win awesome prizes.  Five winners from CalTech will be flown to San Francisco to participate in the The Hacker Games Hackathon Final. 

You must register with a CalTech .edu address to be eligible to attend this event.

events.name: KidsCodeCamp - Pasadena STEM Expo 2012
events.about:
We Want YOU For KidsCodeCamp!

Did you ever want to make a videogame, program a robot, or create a web site? Now you can! 

Come to KidsCodeCamp, a free one-day event to learn how to use computers and technology to make things that do whatever you want.

KidsCodeCamp at the Pasadena STEM(Science, Technology, Engineering, & Math) Expo will take place on Saturday, May 19, 2012 at the Pasadena City College from 9:30 AM to 4:30 PM.

THE SCHEDULE:

9:30 AM - 11:30 AM

KidsRuby (http://kidsruby.com)

Ages: Older Elementary and Up

Have fun and make games, or hack your homework using Ruby! Just tell your parents or teachers you are learning Ruby programming... ;)

KidsRuby is FREE and OPEN SOURCE SOFTWARE* and works on any computer. We have set aside 2 hours to teach kids how to program in Ruby using KidsRuby.

Teacher: Ron Evans (@deadprogram)

-------

11:30 PM - 12:30 PM

Lunch!

-------

12:30 PM - 1:30 PM 

JavaScript

Ages: Middle/High School

We do not have the decription yet, but this class is sure to be cool.

Teachers: TBD

-------

1:30 PM - 2:30 PM

Build A Robot

Ages: Middle school and up

I want to be in this class myself, building your own robot using LEGO Mindstorms. 

Teachers: TBD

------- 
2:30 PM - 3:30 PM 
Room For Another Class 

We have room for another class here. 

Teachers: TBD

 
------- 
3:30 PM - 4:30 PM
Room For Another Class 

We have room for another class here. 

Teachers: TBD

 

======= 

Here is how KidsCodeCamp works:

1. Local volunteers will run classes intended for a particular age group (elementary, middle, or high-school age kids). Each class is from 1 to 2 hours long.

2. Kids register for free, just so everyone knows how many people will be coming.

3. Everyone has fun on the day of KidsCodeCamp!

***** YOU MUST BRING A PORTABLE COMPUTER TO ATTEND! Does not matter which kind, PC or MAC... SORRY NO iPADS/iPODS. *****

Each kid will receive a free USB drive with Open Source* software to use at KidsCodeCamp. Afterwards, they can be used at home, school, or wherever.

KidsCodeCamp at Pasadena STEM Expo is in participation with Pasadena STEM Expo. Special thank you to very much to Pasadena City College for providing the location.

*Open Source means that the actual programing code used to make the software is available for anyone to look at and modify themselves. How cool is that!
